description: Implement the initial application shell using Zig and GTK4. This phase establishes the project structure, build system, and basic UI layout.

userStories.title: Project Setup & Linux Build System
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a reproducible build command so I can compile the application on Linux.
acceptanceCriteria: zig build produces a binary executable
Project compiles against system GTK4 libraries
userStories.notes: Verified build and linking. Runtime fails to open display as expected in headless env, but confirms GTK lib loading.

userStories.title: Main Window with Custom Decorations (CSD)
userStories.description: As a user, I want a modern-looking window so that the app feels native to the GNOME environment.
acceptanceCriteria: Application title and standard window controls (min, max, close) are visible and functional
Visual verification (Launch app and check window frame)

userStories.title: Static Layout Implementation
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see a sidebar and a main area so I can distinguish between tools and the workspace.
acceptanceCriteria: Layout contains a Sidebar on the left (fixed width or minimally static)
Layout contains a Main Content Area on the right
Areas have distinct visual separation (different background colors or borders)

userStories.title: Basic Canvas Interaction
userStories.description: As a user, I want to draw on the canvas so I can see that the application is responsive.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking and dragging on the main canvas area draws pixels (e.g., simplistic single-color line or dots)
Pointer input events are correctly captured by the view
